message: @dmitry looking good!

it is a very nice landing page, only 2 things, the part that says "Achiever" is so plain from the rest of the site that maybe create a logo or something that could make it look like it fits, also the contact and sign in part should be either buttons or bigger again looks so plain and doesn't fit the site, but very well done so far
Any feedback would be greatly appreciated! :)
@italiano40: jQuery/RoR
@ericflo: Thanks so much!

Hey guys. So after about a month of evolving my website's landing page design, I've come upon something I actually feel is really solid. Check out the evolution of my designs here: http://dmitry.imgur.com/CK9B9#zagST
Check out a live version of the new landing page: http://www.getachiever.com
ok nice, just get those problems fixed, get in to some education forums and you may have a hit

@italiano40: I'm working with The Startup Fix soon and maybe he'll help me make a logo. As for the sign in link, I'm going to turn it into a modest login form. Funny enough, those are the basically the only elements from the old designs. Thanks for the feedback!
just curious what was the final app written in? is it a javascript framework and php or ruby?

also feature suggestion, have a sign up for teachers and then students can sub to there teachers and the teacher can post like test 1 and the student just enters in the grade and then the teacher can give the student the curve and stuff

@italiano40: Ah, well, those solutions already exist. Even if most people would rather gouge their eyes out than use them (i.e. Blackboard). This is for those students whose teachers do not offer anything like that.
i know that blackboard but the teacher has to enter each grade, this would be like the teacher just post what the test counts as and crowd sources the entering of the grades to students
@italiano40: Ah, I see.
looks like lightbox/shadowbox is under the youtube window if it was clicked after the movie was played.
@hl: I think I fixed it, but I can't replicate the issue on a Mac. Can you let me know if it functions correctly now?

I think your design suffers from this idea of trying to cram everything "above the fold". Spread it out and it's OK to make people scroll. Most times, people bounce because there is too little information about the product.
See this for some design guidelines - http://paulstamatiou.com/startup-web-design-ux-crash-course
X
@dmitry I'd put some effort into the footer, I think it's often overlooked but really helps the overall feel of the design.

@hrishimittal: Definitely; I'm planning to put more content under what I have. I think possibly where the screenshots are will be a smaller area for social proof and the video will be bigger; the screenshots will be moved down and have actual explanations. And I'm reading that guide now; I also like http://www.visualmess.com/ a lot
@hrishimittal: Also, even though the data is not yet significant, the page is seeing a really good conversion rate!
@dmitry how much conversion?

@hrishimittal: Well, out of 8 people referred to the new design by ads (so discounting HN people who wouldn't use the service anyway), 4 have actually used the site. Out of the 7 people who visited the old design, only one has used it.
@dmitry The shadowbox issue is gone. I'm on Mac Safari and Chrome.
looks familiar *realizes this is where he saw it before* *realizes he neglected to comment* Great work! I really dig the arrow.

I'm not sure about the silent video, though...and I think 2 minutes would be better if you could get a significantly better demo in 2 minutes. If I don't have 2 minutes to watch a video I don't have time to watch a video.
@hl Yay! Thanks.

@bat Hey, thanks! That was my first attempt at video editing ever and I'm pretty happy so far. I have a lot (a lot) of work to do on the internals and will of course make a new video. But, damn, I have a lot of work to do inside the app.
